thread.title: Trump, Pence and Bannon will all speak at CPAC | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Trump, Pence and Bannon will all speak at CPAC | Daily Mail Online

author: Nikki Schwab
title: Trump, Pence and Bannon will all speak at CPAC | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad Trump, Pence and Bannon will all take the stage at CPAC as Milo Yiannopoulos is disinvited over comments 'condoning pedophilia' President Donald Trump will be the first president in office to appear at the Conservative Political Action Conference in nine years Other top officials including Vice President Mike Pence will attend - while Steve Bannon and Reince Priebus will appear together onstage Organizers for CPAC rescinded an invitation to 'alt-right' provocateur Milo Yiannopoulos earlier today This comes after comments Yiannopoulos made went viral, in which he praised homosexual relationships between 'boys and older men' Yiannopoulos tried to backpedal on Facebook, saying he was the victim of selective editing and his comments weren't meant to condone pedophilia But American Conservative Union head Matt Schlapp said that organizers decided to revoke his speaking slot 'due to the revelation of an offensive video' Published: 20:37 GMT, 20 February 2017 | Updated: 22:17 GMT, 20 February 2017 312 shares
